intro: Calochortus ambiguus, commonly known as the ambiguous mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes a variety of flowering plants commonly referred to as mariposa lilies. This species is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open grasslands and woodland areas. It is a perennial herb that produces a basal rosette of leaves and a single flowering stalk.
